abstract: Health care experts say while Supreme Court ruling against federal subsidies contained within Pres Obama's health care reform law would damage legacy he sought to leave, many positive aspects of law would remain in effect; yet such a ruling would mean years of uncertainty surrounding law, and Republicans are excited by possibility that court could hamper law in way they have failed to do legislatively.
lead_paragraph: The president’s allies and adversaries agree on one thing: that an unraveling of subsidies in the Affordable Care Act would be devastating.

headline.main: A Ruling Against Obama Would Damage, Not Negate, a Health Care Legacy
headline.print_headline: A Ruling Against Obama Would Damage, Not Erase, a Health Care Legacy

snippet: The president’s allies and adversaries agree on one thing: that an unraveling of subsidies in the Affordable Care Act would be devastating.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
